name: Bern Convention Appendix 1
label: Bern-A1
description: Special protection (`appropriate and necessary legislative and administrative measures`) for the plant taxa listed, including prohibition of deliberate picking, collecting, cutting, uprooting and, as appropriate, possession or sale.

name: Bern Convention Appendix 2
label: Bern-A2

name: Bern Convention Appendix 3
label: Bern-A3
description: Special protection through 'appropriate and necessary legislative and administrative measures', of the listed wild fauna species.

name: Bird Population Status - amber
label: Bird-Amber
description: Amber list species are those with an unfavourable conservation status in Europe; those whose population or range has declined moderately in recent years; those whose population has declined historically but made a substantial recent recovery; rare breeders; and those with internationally important or localised populations.

name: Bird Population Status - red
label: Bird-Red
description: Red list species are those that are Globally Threatened according to IUCN criteria; those whose population or range has declined rapidly in recent years; and those that have declined historically and not shown a substantial recent recovery.

name: Birds Directive Annex 1
label: BirdsDir-A1
description: Birds which are the subject of special conservation measures concerning their habitat in order to ensure their survival and reproduction in their area of distribution. As appropriate, Special Protection Areas to be established to assist conservation measures. Note that the contents of this annex have been updated in April 2003 following the Treaty of Accession.

name: Birds Directive Annex 2.1
label: BirdsDir-A2.1
description: Birds which may potentially be hunted under national legislation within the geographical land and sea area to which the Directive applies. (Note that some species are protected by the national legislation of some Member States although hunting would potentially be legal under the Directive).

name: Birds Directive Annex 2.2
label: BirdsDir-A2.2
description: Birds which may potentially be hunted under national legislation only within certain specified Member States. (Note that some species are protected by the national legislation of some Member States although hunting would potentially be legal under the Directive).

name: Convention on Migratory Species,  Small Cetaceans Agreement, Baltic, NE.Atlantic, Irish, N Seas
label: CMS_ASCOBANS
description: Conservation of small cetacean species to achieve favourable conservation status, conscious that the management of threats to their existence, such as bycatch, habitat deterioration and other anthropogenic disturbance, requires concerted and coordinated responses.

name: Convention on Migratory Species, African-Eurasian Waterbirds Agreement - Annex II
label: CMS_AEWA-A2
description: Conservation of migratory waterbirds, giving special attention to endangered species as well as to those with an unfavourable conservation status.

name: Convention on Migratory Species, Appendix 1
label: CMS_A1
description: Endangered migratory species in danger of extinction throughout all or a significant portion of their range, and for which Range States are obliged to prohibit taking and to take protective measures to conserve. (Note that taking may be permitted in some circumstances as outlined in Article III.5.)

name: Convention on Migratory Species, Appendix 2
label: CMS_A2
description: Migratory species having an unfavourable conservation status for which Range States are encouraged to conclude international agreements for their benefit.

name: Convention on Migratory Species, EUROBATS - Annex I
label: CMS_EUROBATS-A1
description: Protection and enhancement of species populations through legislation, education, conservation measures and international co-operation.

name: EC CITES Annex A
label: ECCITES-A
description:
All CITES Appendix I species. 
Some CITES Appendix II and III species, for which the EU has adopted stricter domestic measures. 
Some non-CITES species.

name: EC CITES Annex B
label: ECCITES-B
description:
All other CITES Appendix II species not listed in Annex A.
Some CITES Appendix III species.
Some non-CITES species.

name: EC CITES Annex C
label: ECCITES-C
description: All other CITES Appendix III species not listed in Annex A or Annex B.

name: EC CITES Annex D
label: ECCITES-D
description:
Some CITES Appendix III species for which the EU holds a reservation (CITES reservations - English, French, Spanish). 
Some non-CITES species.

name: Habitats Directive Annex 2 - non-priority species
label: HabDir-A2*
description: Animal and plant species of Community interest (i.e. endangered, vulnerable, rare or endemic in the European Community) whose conservation requires the designation of special areas of conservation. Note that the contents of this annex have been updated in April 2003 following the Treaty of Accession.

name: Habitats Directive Annex 2 - priority species
label: HabDir-A2
description: Species which are endangered, the conservation of which the Community has a particular responsibility in view of the proportion of their natural range which falls within the territory of the Community. They require the designation of special areas of conservation.

name: Habitats Directive Annex 4
label: HabDir-A4
description: Animal and plant species of Community interest (i.e. endangered, vulnerable, rare or endemic in the European Community) in need of strict protection. They are protected from killing, disturbance or the destruction of them or their habitat. Note that the contents of this annex have been updated in April 2003 following the Treaty of Accession.

name: Habitats Directive Annex 5
label: HabDir-A5
description: Animal and plant species of Community interest whose taking in the wild and exploitation may be subject to management measures.

name: IUCN (1994) - Critically endangered
label: RedList_GB_post94-CR
description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when it is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate future, as defined by any of the criteria A to E.

name: IUCN (1994) - Data Deficient
label: RedList_GB_post94-DD
description: A taxon is Data Deficient when there is inadequate information to make a direct, or indirect, assessment of its risk of extinction based on its distribution and/or population status. A taxon in this category may be well studied, and its biology well known, but appropriate data on abundance and/or distribution are lacking. Data Deficient is therefore not a category of threat or Lower Risk. Listing of taxa in this category indicates that more information is required and acknowledges the possibility that future research will show that a threatened category is appropriate.

name: IUCN (1994) - Data Deficient
label: RedList_Global_post94-DD
description: A taxon is Data Deficient when there is inadequate information to make a direct, or indirect, assessment of its risk of extinction based on its distribution and/or population status. A taxon in this category may be well studied, and its biology well known, but appropriate data on abundance and/or distribution are lacking. Data Deficient is therefore not a category of threat or Lower Risk. Listing of taxa in this category indicates that more information is required and acknowledges the possibility that future research will show that a threatened category is appropriate.

name: IUCN (1994) - Endangered
label: RedList_GB_post94-EN
description: A taxon is Endangered when it is not Critically endangered but is facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild in the near future.

name: IUCN (1994) - Endangered
label: RedList_Global_post94-EN
description: Taxa in danger of extinction and whose survival is unlikely if the causal factors continue operating. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: IUCN (1994) - Extinct
label: RedList_GB_post94-EX
description: Taxa which are no longer known to exist in the wild after repeated searches of their localities and other known likely places.Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: IUCN (1994) - Lower risk - conservation dependent
label: RedList_Global_post94-LR(cd)
description: Taxa which are the focus of a continuing taxon-specific or habitat-specific conservation programme targeted towards the taxon in question, the cessation of which would result in the taxon qualifying for one of the threatened categories above within a period of five years.

name: IUCN (1994) - Lower risk - near threatened
label: RedList_GB_post94-NT
description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.

name: IUCN (1994) - Lower risk - near threatened
label: RedList_Global_post94-NT
description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.

name: IUCN (1994) - Vulnerable
label: RedList_GB_post94-VU
description: A taxon is Vulnerable when it is not Critically Endangered or Endangered but is facing a high risk of extinction in the wild in the medium term future.

name: IUCN (2001) - Critically endangered
label: RedList_GB_post2001-CR
description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when it is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate future, as defined by any of the criteria A to E.

name: IUCN (2001) - Critically endangered
label: RedList_Global_post2001-CR
description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the criteria A to E for Critically Endangered (see Section V), and it is therefore considered to be facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild.

name: IUCN (2001) - Data Deficient
label: RedList_GB_post2001-DD
description: A taxon is Data Deficient when there is inadequate information to make a direct, or indirect, assessment of its risk of extinction based on its distribution and/or population status. A taxon in this category may be well studied, and its biology well known, but appropriate data on abundance and/or distribution are lacking. Data Deficient is therefore not a category of threat or Lower Risk. Listing of taxa in this category indicates that more information is required and acknowledges the possibility that future research will show that a threatened category is appropriate.

name: IUCN (2001) - Data Deficient
label: RedList_Global_post2001_DD
description: A taxon is Data Deficient when there is inadequate information to make a direct, or indirect, assessment of its risk of extinction based on its distribution and/or population status. A taxon in this category may be well studied, and its biology well known, but appropriate data on abundance and/or distribution are lacking. Data Deficient is therefore not a category of threat. Listing of taxa in this category indicates that more information is required and acknowledges the possibility that future research will show that threatened classification is appropriate. It is important to make positive use of whatever data are available. In many cases great care should be exercised in choosing between DD and a threatened status. If the range of a taxon is suspected to be relatively circumscribed, and a considerable period of time has elapsed since the last record of the taxon, threatened status may well be justified.

name: IUCN (2001) - Endangered
label: RedList_GB_post2001-EN
description: A taxon is Endangered when it is not Critically endangered but is facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild in the near future.

name: IUCN (2001) - Endangered
label: RedList_Global_post2001-EN
description: A taxon is Endangered when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the criteria A to E for Endangered (see Section V), and it is therefore considered to be facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild.

name: IUCN (2001) - Extinct
label: RedList_GB_post2001-EX
description: A taxon is Extinct in Great Britain when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual in Great Britain has died. A taxon is presumed extinct when exhaustive surveys in known and/or expected habitat, at appropriate times (diurnal, seasonal, annual), throughout its historical range have failed to record an individual. Surveys should be over a time scale appropriate to the taxon's life cycle and life form.

name: IUCN (2001) - Extinct
label: RedList_Global_post2001_EX
description: A taxon is Extinct when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual has died. A taxon is presumed Extinct when exhaustive surveys in known and/or expected habitat, at appropriate times (diurnal, seasonal, annual), throughout its historic range have failed to record an individual. Surveys should be over a time frame appropriate to the taxon's life cycle and life form.

name: IUCN (2001) - Extinct in the wild
label: RedList_GB_post2001-EW
description: A taxon is Extinct in the wild in Great Britain when it is known to survive only in cultivation, in captivity or as a naturalised population (or populations) well outside the past range. A taxon is presumed extinct in the wild when exhaustive surveys in known and/or expected habitat, at appropriate times (diurnal, seasonal, annual) throughout its range have failed to record an individual. Surveys should be over a time frame appropriate to the taxon's life cycle and life form.

name: IUCN (2001) - Lower risk - near threatened
label: RedList_GB_post2001-NT
description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.

name: IUCN (2001) - Lower risk - near threatened
label: RedList_Global_post2001_NT
description: A taxon is Near Threatened when it has been evaluated against the criteria but does not qualify for Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable now, but is close to qualifying for or is likely to qualify for a threatened category in the near future.

name: IUCN (2001) - Regionally Extinct
label: RedList_GB_post2001-RE
description: Category for a taxon when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual potentially capble of reproduction within the region has died or has disappeared from the wild in the region, or when, if it is a former visiting taxon, the last individual has died or disappeared in the wild from the region. The setting of any time limit for listing under RE is left to the discretion of the regional Red List authority, but should not normally pre-date 1500 AD.

name: IUCN (2001) - Vulnerable
label: RedList_GB_post2001-VU
description: A taxon is Vulnerable when it is not Critically Endangered or Endangered but is facing a high risk of extinction in the wild in the medium term future.

name: IUCN (2001) - Vulnerable
label: RedList_Global_post2001-VU
description: A taxon is Vulnerable when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the criteria A to E for Vulnerable (see Section V), and it is therefore considered to be facing a high risk of extinction in the wild.

name: IUCN (pre 1994) - Endangered
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-EN
description: Taxa in danger of extinction and whose survival is unlikely if the causal factors continue operating. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: IUCN (pre 1994) - Extinct
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-EX
description: Taxa which are no longer known to exist in the wild after repeated searches of their localities and other known likely places.Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: IUCN (pre 1994) - Rare
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-R
description: Taxa with small populations that are not at present Endangered or Vulnerable, but are at risk. (In GB, this was interpreted as species which exist in fifteen or fewer 10km squares). Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: IUCN (pre 1994) - Vulnerable
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-VU
description: Taxa believed likely to move into the Endangered category in the near future if the causal factors continue operating. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: Nationally Notable
label: Notable
description: Species which are estimated to occur within the range of 16 to 100 10km squares. (subdivision into Notable A and Notable B is not always possible because there may be insufficient information available). Superseded by Nationally Scarce, and therefore no longer in use.

name: Nationally Notable A
label: Notable-A
description: Taxa which do not fall within RDB categories but which are none-the-less uncommon in Great Britain and thought to occur in 30 or fewer 10km squares of the National Grid or, for less well-recorded groups, within seven or fewer vice-counties. Superseded by Nationally Scarce, and therefore no longer in use.

name: Nationally Notable B
label: Notable-B
description: Taxa which do not fall within RDB categories but which are none-the-less uncommon in Great Britain and thought to occur in between 31 and 100 10km squares of the National Grid or, for less-well recorded groups between eight and twenty vice-counties. Superseded by Nationally Scarce, and therefore no longer in use.

name: Nationally rare marine species
label: Marine-NR
description: Species which occur in eight or fewer 10km X 10km grid squares containing sea (or water of marine saline influence) within the three mile territorial limit.

name: Nationally scarce marine species
label: Marine-NS
description: Species which occur in nine to 55 10km X 10km grid squares containing sea (or water of marine saline influence) within the three mile territorial limit.

name: Natural Environment and Rural Communities Act 2006 - Species of Principal Importance in England (sec
label: England NERC S.41
description: Species “of principal importance for the purpose of conserving biodiversity” covered under section 41 (England) of the NERC Act (2006) and therefore need to be taken into consideration by a public body when performing any of its functions with a view to conserving biodiversity.

name: Natural Environment and Rural Communities Act 2006 - Species of Principal Importance in Wales (secti
label: Wales NERC S.42
description: Species “of principal importance for the purpose of conserving biodiversity” covered under Section 42 (Wales) of the NERC Act (2006) and therefore need to be taken into consideration by a public body when performing any of its functions with a view to conserving biodiversity.

name: OSPAR Convention
label: OSPAR
description: OSPAR Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic. OSPAR List of Threatened and/or Declining Species and Habitats.

name: Priority Species (Northern Ireland)
label: NI_Priority
description: The Northern Ireland Priority List of threatened species requiring conservation action in Northern Ireland. Criteria have been developed to ensure that Priority Species have been chosen using a scientific basis (See http-//www.habitas.org.uk/priority/criteria.html). The list is designed to assist those involved in the conservation of biodiversity by guiding decisions on where to target action and invest resources.

name: Protection of Badgers Act (1992)
label: Protection of Badgers Act (1992)
description: The Protection of Badgers Act 1992 protects badgers from taking, injuring, killing, cruel treatment, selling, possessing, marking and having their setts interfered with, subject to exceptions.

name: RDB - Indeterm
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-Inde
description: Taxa not seen since 1970 but require further survey before they can be declared extinctknown to be Extinct, Endangered, Vulnerable or Rare, but where there is not enough information to say which of these categories is appropriate. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, so no longer in use.

name: RDB - Insuff known
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-Insu
description: Taxa that are suspected but not definitely known to belong to any of the above categories (i.e. Endangered, Vulnerable, Rare), because of the lack of information. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, so no longer in use.

name: RDB - Threatened endemic
label: RedList_GB_Pre94-Thre
description: Taxa which are not known to occur naturally outside Britain.  Taxa within this category may also be in any of the other RDB categories or not threatened at all.

name: Scottish Biodiversity List of species of principal importance for biodiversity conservation
label: Scottish Biodiversity List
description:
The Scottish Biodiversity List is a list of flora, fauna and habitats considered by the Scottish Ministers to be of principal importance for biodiversity conservation. The development of the list has been a collaborative effort involving a great many stakeholders overseen by scientists from the Scottish Biodiversity Forum. Completion of the list is the first time such a stocktake has been done in Scotland.

The Scottish Biodiversity List is a tool for public bodies and others doing their Biodiversity Duty. The publication of the Scottish Biodiversity List satisfies the requirements of Section 2(4) of The Nature Conservation (Scotland) Act 2004.

name: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 2010 (Schedule 2)
label: HabReg-Sch2
description: Schedule 2- European protected species of animals.

name: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 2010 (Schedule 4)
label: HabReg-Sch4
description: Schedule 4- Animals which may not be taken or killed in certain ways

name: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 2010 (Schedule 5)
label: HabReg-Sch5
description: Schedule 5- European protected species of plants.

name: The Conservation (Nature Habitats, etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) - Schedule 2
label: ConsRegsNI-Sch2
description: Schedule 2- European protected species of animals.

name: The Conservation (Nature Habitats, etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) - Schedule 3
label: ConsRegsNI-Sch3
description: Schedule 3- Animals which may not be taken or killed in certain ways.

name: The Conservation (Nature Habitats, etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) - Schedule 4
label: ConsRegsNI-Sch4
description: Schedule 4- European Protected Species of Plants

name: The Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (Schedule 1 Part 1)
label: W(NI)O-Sch1_part1
description: Birds which are protected by special penalties at all times.

name: The Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (Schedule 1 Part 2)
label: W(NI)O-Sch1_part2
description: Birds which are protected by special penalties during the close season.

name: The Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (Schedule 5)
label: W(NI)O-Sch5
description: Animals which are protected at all times.

name: The Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (Schedule 8 - Part 1)
label: W(NI)O-Sch8_part1
description: Plants which are protected from intentional picking, removal or destruction and from selling (in whole or part) and from advertising for sale.

name: The Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (Schedule 8 - Part 2)
label: W(NI)O-Sch8_part2
description: Plants which may not be sold.

name: UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species
label: BAP-2007
description: The UK List of Priority Species and Habitats contains 1150 species and 65 habitats that have been listed as priorities for conservation action under the UK Biodiversity Action Plan (UK BAP).

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 1 Part 1)
label: WACA-Sch1_part1
description: Birds which are protected by special penalties at all times.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 1 Part 2)
label: WACA-Sch1_part2
description: Birds which are protected by special penalties during the close season.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.1 (killing/injuring))
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.1(kill/injuring)
description: Section 9.1. Animals which are protected from intentional killing or injuring.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.1 (taking))
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.1(taking)
description: Section 9.1 Animals which are protected from taking.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.2)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.2
description: Section 9.2 Animals which are protected from being possessed or controlled (live or dead).

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.4a)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.4a
description: Intentionally or recklessly disturbs any wild animal included in Schedule 5.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.4b)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.4b
description: Section 9.4 Animals which are protected from intentional disturbance while occupying a structure or place used for shelter or protection.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.5a)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.5a
description: Section 9.5 Animals which are protected from being sold, offered for sale or being held or transported for sale either live or dead, whole or part.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.5b)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.5b
description: Section 9.5 Animals which are protected from being published or advertised as being for sale.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5)
label: WACA-Sch5Sect9.4A*
description: Ceteaca/basking shark that are not allowed to be intentionally or recklessly disturbed.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5)
label: WACA-Sch5Sect9.4c
description: Animals which are protected from their access to any structure or place which they use for shelter or protection being obstructed.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 8)
label: WACA-Sch8
description: Plants which are protected from intentional picking, uprooting or destruction (Section 13 1a); selling, offering for sale, possessing or transporting for the purpose of sale (live or dead, part or derivative) (Section 13 2a); advertising (any of these) for buying or selling (Section 13 2b).

name: IUCN (1994) - Critically endangered
label: RedList_Global_post94-CR
description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when it is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate future, as defined by any of the criteria A to E.

name: IUCN (1994) - Vulnerable
label: RedList_Global_post94-VU
description: Taxa believed likely to move into the Endangered category in the near future if the causal factors continue operating. Superseded by new IUCN categories in 1994, but still applicable to lists that have not been reviewed since 1994.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5)
label: WACA-Sch5
description: It applies only to England. Animals given general protection under section 9 - http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2008/431/note/made

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.1
description: Intentionally kills, injures or takes any wild animal included in Schedule 5

name: Nationally Rare. Excludes Red Listed taxa
label: NR-excludes
description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Excludes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.

name: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
label: NR-includes
description: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa.

name: Nationally Scarce. Excludes Red Listed taxa
label: NS-excludes
description: Nationally Scarce - Occurring in 16-100 hectads in Great Britain. Excludes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.

name: Nationally Scarce. Includes Red Listed taxa
label: NS-includes
description: Nationally Scarce. Includes Red Listed taxa.

name: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Schedule 5 Section 9.4, subdivision a)
label: WACA-Sch5_sect9.4.a
description: Section 9.4 subdivision a - Animals which are protected from intentional damage or destruction to any structure or place used for shelter or protection.
